greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the smallest prime p such that Kronecker(-n,p) = -1.
comment: Conjecture: lim sup log(a(n))/log(n) = 0. For example, it seems that log(a(n))/log(n) < 0.5 for all n > 1364.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = 2 if and only if n == 3, 5 (mod 8). See A047621.
a(n) = 3 if and only if n == 1, 4, 7, 10, 16, 22 (mod 24).
maple: while NumberTheory:-KroneckerSymbol(-n,p) <> -1 do p:= nextprime(p) od:
mathematica: a[n_] := For[p = 2, True, p = NextPrime[p], If[KroneckerSymbol[-n, p] == -1, Return[p]]];
results.author: _Jianing Song_, Jan 29 2019
